title: India to Send Astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla to International Space Station After 40-Year Gap
summary: India is preparing to send astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla to the International Space Station (ISS) in May, marking the country's return to human spaceflight after a 40-year hiatus. This mission represents a significant milestone in India's space program and its growing collaboration with international space agencies.
content: India is set to achieve a major milestone in its space program as it prepares to send astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla to the International Space Station (ISS) in May 2024. This historic mission marks India's return to human spaceflight after a gap of four decades, signaling the country's growing ambitions in space exploration and international space cooperation.

source.title: After 40 years, India to send astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla to International Space Station in May
